intro: Matisia anchicayana, commonly known as the Anchicayana matisia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of mostly tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Matisia anchicayana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
